issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.iqiyi.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.iqiyi.com%2F) ### Comment > 在https://www.iqiyi.com/封面右键元素里找到播放链接，如果AdGuard开启下面2项功就算把问题域名设为白名单世 > 不能解决问题 > 1,【"AdGuard URL跟踪过滤器 > 通过从URL中删除跟踪参数来增强隐私的过滤器。” > 2."Legitimate URL Shortener > 自动从URL中删除不必要的"$'和'&'值，使它们更容易从URL栏中复制并作为链接 > 粘贴到其他地方。已包含在Dandelion Sprout的防骚扰列表中。】" > 会导致爱奇艺视频网站不能正常打开。关闭AdGuārd打开元素里面复制的链接就正 > 常打开 > 这是我最喜欢的2个功希望能修复规则，同时网站也是最知名的视频网站 > > > > Find the playback link in the element.If AdGuard enables the > following two functions,even if the problem domain is > whitelisted,it cannot solve the problem > 1.AdGuard URL Tracking Filter > A privacy enhancing filter that removes tracking parameters > from URLs > 2.Legal URL Shorter > Automatically remove unnecessary '$and'&'values from > URLs,making them easier to copy from the URL bar and > paste as links elsewhere.Already included in Dandelion > Sprout's anti harassment list > It will cause the iQiyi video website to not open properly. > Close AdGuard and open the copied link in the element to > open it normally > These are my favorite 2 features that I hope can fix the rules. > and the website is also the most well-known video website ### Screenshots

Browsing Security: | enabled Browsing Security statistics: | enabled Userscripts: | disabled Other extensions used: | AdGuard Improvement Report Dear AdGuard Team, Hello! I've encountered some issues while using AdGuard and hope they can be improved. I'm using Android 15.0 on my phone, and the following apps have ads that AdGuard fails to block effectively: 1. iQIYI (Version 16.4.7): There are long pre - roll ads before video playback, mid - roll ads during playback, and ads on some film and TV recommendation pages. 2. Douyin (Version 34.3.0): Advertisement videos are interspersed in the video feed, and ad recommendations sometimes appear on the search results page. 3. X (Version 10.96.0 - release.0): Advertisement tweets show up in the home feed, and there are ad spaces on the sidebar. 4. Uptodown App Store (Version 6.66): There are ads on the app recommendation page. 5. Kuaishou (Version 13.4.10.41735): Ads are displayed on the video recommendation page and personal homepage, and ads may also pop up during live broadcasts. 6. QQ Browser (Version 16.3.0.0033): There are ads on the new tab page and search results page, and some ads cannot be blocked while browsing web pages. 7. TikTok (Version 39.8.4): Similar to Douyin, there are ads on the video feed and search results pages. 8. Tencent Video (Version 9.01.20.29991): There are ads before, during, and after video playback, and there are also a small number of promotional ads in VIP - exclusive content. 9. Youku Video (Version 11.1.38): Ads are frequent before and during video playback, and there are also ads on the drama details page. 10. Browser (Version 40.9.10.1_bdc29ce_250509): Some web ads cannot be blocked while browsing. 11. Weibo (Version 15.5.0): Ads are interspersed in the home feed, and there are also ads on topic pages and search results pages. 12. Facebook (Version 512.0.0.64.75): Promotional posts often appear in the news feed, and there are ad spaces on the sidebar. 13. Instagram (Version 379.1.0.43.80): Sponsored content ads appear in the user feed, and ad recommendations may also be on the explore page. 14. Threads (Version 380.0.0.45.88): Currently, ads have started to appear in the content feed, affecting the user experience. 15. YouTube (Version 20.18.34): There are many pre - roll ads, mid - roll ads during video playback, and ads on the video recommendation page. 16. QQ Mail (Version 7.0.3): There may be advertising emails in the mail list, and ads are also displayed on some function pages. 17. Gmail (Version 2025.04.27.755574423.Release): Ads appear on the sidebar of the mail list and other positions. 18. Google Play Store (Version 46.0.19 - 31 [0] [PR] 751509063): There are promotional ads on app recommendation and ranking pages. Hope the AdGuard team can optimize and improve the ad - blocking for these apps to enhance the user experience. Thank you very much! Report Date: May 13, 2025, 23:36 (Washington, D.C. time)

comment.body:
>`pixel.everesttech.net`

We already have in AdGuard Tracking Protection filter:
```adblock
||everesttech.net^$third-party
```

<hr>

>`snap.licdn.com`

In AdGuard Tracking Protection filter there are:
```adblock
||media.licdn.com/cdo/rum/id?
||licdn.com/*li.lms-analytics/
```
need example.

<hr>

>`sc-static.net`

Should be blocked by (from AdGuard Tracking Protection filter):
```adblock
||sc-static.net^$third-party
```

<hr>

>`match.adsrvr.org`

Already in Base filter:
```adblock
||adsrvr.org^$third-party
```

<hr>

>`adobe.demdex.net`

 In AdGuard Tracking Protection filter:
```adblock
||demdex.net^
```

<hr>

>`servedby.flashtalking.com`

In Base filter:
```adblock
||flashtalking.com^$third-party,domain=~toggo.de
```

<hr>

>`cdnssl.clicktale.net`

In AdGuard Tracking Protection filter:
```adblock
||clicktale.net^$third-party
```

<hr>

>`api.demandbase.com`

In AdGuard Tracking Protection filter:
```adblock
||demandbase.com^$third-party
```

<hr>

>`https://www.adobe.com/experienceedge/jpn3/v1/collect?`
`||adobe.com/experienceedge/*/v*/collect?`

In AdGuard Tracking Protection filter:
```adblock
||adobe.com/experienceedge/*/collect?
```

```adblock
||everestjs.net^$third-party
```

issue.title: Add global removal for  Substack "subscribe" landing page to Adguard Annoyance.

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Many (all?) Substack pages currently feature a pop-over landing page asking you to subscribe. This is highly annoying.

As an example, see https://chipsandcheese.com or https://www.noahpinion.blog/.

### Proposed solution

Currently there is a few Substacks in the filter lists that remove this pop-over.
It would be nice to replace this with a global filter rule added to the `Annoyance filter` (under the `Pop-ups` or `Other Annoyances` subfilter) , removing the pop-over for every substack page.

### Additional information

_No response_

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Many (all?) Substack pages currently feature a pop-over landing page asking you to subscribe. This is highly annoying.

As an example, see https://chipsandcheese.com or https://www.noahpinion.blog/.

### Proposed solution

Currently there is a few Substacks in the filter lists that remove this pop-over.
It would be nice to replace this with a global filter rule added to the `Annoyance filter` (under the `Pop-ups` or `Other Annoyances` subfilter) , removing the pop-over for every substack page.

### Additional information

_No response_

issue.title: Add global removal for  Substack "subscribe" landing page to Adguard Annoyance.

labels.name: A: Cannot reproduce
labels.description: Filters devs cannot reproduce this issue

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Many (all?) Substack pages currently feature a pop-over landing page asking you to subscribe. This is highly annoying.

As an example, see https://chipsandcheese.com or https://www.noahpinion.blog/.

### Proposed solution

Currently there is a few Substacks in the filter lists that remove this pop-over.
It would be nice to replace this with a global filter rule added to the `Annoyance filter` (under the `Pop-ups` or `Other Annoyances` subfilter) , removing the pop-over for every substack page.

### Additional information

_No response_

comment.body:
Yes, I fixed it by adding a specific domain. But if you could make a universal rule for all sites, it would be more convenient than adding a domain every time.

@Alex-302 is it possible to make a universal rule?

issue.title: Add global removal for  Substack "subscribe" landing page to Adguard Annoyance.

labels.name: A: Cannot reproduce
labels.description: Filters devs cannot reproduce this issue

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Many (all?) Substack pages currently feature a pop-over landing page asking you to subscribe. This is highly annoying.

As an example, see https://chipsandcheese.com or https://www.noahpinion.blog/.

### Proposed solution

Currently there is a few Substacks in the filter lists that remove this pop-over.
It would be nice to replace this with a global filter rule added to the `Annoyance filter` (under the `Pop-ups` or `Other Annoyances` subfilter) , removing the pop-over for every substack page.

### Additional information

_No response_

comment.body:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/202953#issuecomment-2878893814

> Hello, thanks for your help in advance! Essentially, every couple of seconds, a tab/pop-up opens whenever I click something on this website. This could be whenever I click into a new show, or the search button, or even when clicking the pause/full-screen button. This issue has only started happening recently.
> 
> Any steps you need to do to recreate this is to just open the website. I start getting the popups a few seconds later after opening the website.
> 
> Thanks again for your help.

Unfortunately, I cannot reproduce it.
Please try to disable then enable content blockers in Safari settings, restart Safari and check for filters update. Do not close AdGuard window for 30-60 seconds (until update process will be finished).

issue.title: /wrapperMessagingWithoutDetection.js needed for various Norwegian sites [GDPR]
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Cookie popup (`/wrapperMessagingWithoutDetection.js`) at these Norwegian sites:
```
agderposten.no
avisafroya.no
banett.no
bomlo-nytt.no
doktoronline.no (subpage example: forum.doktoronline.no)
fitjarposten.no
fvn.no
gauldalsposten.no
kulingen.no
kystogfjord.no
l-a.no
lp.no
marsteinen.no
mn24.no
morgenbladet.no
opp.no
oyposten.no
porten.no
randaberg24.no
s-n.no
steinkjer24.no
stord24.no
sunnhordland.no
vaganavisa.no
```

### Proposed solution

For '**AdGuard Cookie Notices filter**':
`/wrapperMessagingWithoutDetection.js$domain=agderposten.no|avisafroya.no|banett.no|bomlo-nytt.no|doktoronline.no|fitjarposten.no|fvn.no|gauldalsposten.no|kulingen.no|kystogfjord.no|l-a.no|lp.no|marsteinen.no|mn24.no|morgenbladet.no|opp.no|oyposten.no|porten.no|randaberg24.no|s-n.no|steinkjer24.no|stord24.no|sunnhordland.no|vaganavisa.no`

### Additional information

Also reported here:
https://github.com/easylist/easylist/issues/21036/
https://github.com/uBlockOrigin/uAssets/issues/22533#issuecomment-2510303143

Hello @THEtomaso

comment.body:
> not cause any problems at all when I browse in Brave.

Brave uses it's own filtering engine, as I know.
AdGuard uses Safari Content Blocking API + own Advanced Protection extension (for scriptlets). It is a black box for us. Even filtering log is impossible here.

Could you please test when all your filters are enabled, but Advanced Protection is turned off?
@punisher018 Ok, removed the rules with numbers.

comment.body:
Hi,Mr. Alex-302. I'm the reporter of this issue. This issue seems to be difficult to fix due to the difficulty of reproducing.

My device is iphone12(4gb RAM), and this issue is seen on all my family's devices , but the frequency of reloading or crashing is  lower in relatively new device such as iphone15 pro. 
I tested those five filters by turning them on and off and using one filter to find out which filter causes this issue. Those filters don't cause reloading or crasing when only one filter is enabled, but the time of finishing processes differs. 

First,I tested without Easylist cookie list(the rest four filters were enabled), the frequency of reloading or crashing obviously decreased(though it occured occasionally).
The same trend was observed when testing without adguard base and adguard popups, but when testing without adguard japanese and adguard mobile ads, crashing and website reloading occurred.   

Next, I tested with just one filter enabled.
On my end, adguard japanese and adguard mobile ads rarely affect on displaying products. 
Adguard popup,easylist cookie list,adguard base increased the processing time in adguard in that order. However,these five filters do not cause any problems at all when I browse in Brave. 

I wish I could point out which rule or filter causes this issue like other professionals can, but I am too amature with contents blockers.

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: Extra
labels.description: Issues, related to AdGuard Extra extension

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)
